adjective.description: (of food, or premises in which food is sold, cooked, or eaten) satisfying the requirements of Jewish law.

examples: she consulted lawyers to make sure everything was kosher

verb.description: Prepare (food) according to the requirements of Jewish law.

phrases: As an orthodox Jew, he observes Shabbat, eats kosher, and prays three times a day.
His family kept kosher, went to services and developed its community around the temple.
I worked at the Hebrew Academy Day Camp; many of the girls I dated in high school kept kosher.
He explained the rituals of eating kosher and keeping Shabbat as spiritual practices.
I figured there was no reason to mention that I now kept kosher and make a scene.
origin: Mid 19th century: from Hebrew kāšēr proper.
